newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Product Swaps -Gas oil steady on cash support.
newsitem.headline: Asia Product Swaps -Gas oil steady on cash support.

text.p: Singapore gas oil swaps were steady at midday on Thursday after strong support in the physical market amid firmer crude prices.
"Gas oil is holding its own at this level after the new buying interest late yesterday," one trader said.
May gas oil swaps were last quoted $25.30/$25.40 per barrel, largely unchanged from Wednesday, brokers said.
June was quoted down 10 cents at $24.80/$24.90. June traded earlier in the day at $24.85, they said.
The May/June spread is narrowing in line with the flat physical market with the backwardation now valued at about 50 cents with 50 cents traded on Wednesday.

In the physical market, a European refiner sold to a local trader one cargo at $25.25 per barrel for June 2-6 lifting, and another European trader sold to a Japanese trader at $25.20 for May 22-26 lifting, traders said.
Traders' willingness to buy cargoes at these levels gave the swaps fresh impetus to strengthen after drifting sideways early week.
Traders said the firmer sentiment was also due to stronger overnight crude with June Brent closing up nine cents to $18.16 per barrel.
The jet fuel/gas oil spread or regrade edged down on market expectations of sustained selling from refiners in the face of weak enduser demand.
June regrade was last quoted at 40/60 cents down from Tuesday's 50/60 cents, brokers said.
Fuel oil swaps were steady with May last quoted unchanged from Wednesday at $100.00/$101.00 per tonne.
